page.title: 05Transport_Railways
page.content:
East Grinstead has a modern station near the town centre and has a regular hourly service to Croydon and London (on some you have change trains at Croydon for London).There are some fast trains,which stop at less stations.At the moment the service is diesel powered units,but the line is soon to be electrified to provide a faster service.British Railways run extra trains during peak hours.The preserved Bluebell Railway is planning to extend its service from Horstead Keynes to East Grinstead,and has goverment permission,but land has to be purchased,and some opposition remains.
by Tom Brophy
